question.text: Which one of the following is a correct statement?

options.text: "Bt" in "Bt-cotton" indicates that it is a genetically modified organism produced through biotechnology.
Somatic hybridization involves fusion of two complete plant cells carrying desired genes.
The transgenic Brassica napus seeds are used for production of antibiotics.
"FlavrSavr" variety of tomato has enhanced the production of ethylene which improves its taste.

solution.text: Bt in Bt cotton stands for Bacillus thuringienesis and is a pest-resistant transgenic plant. The transgenic Brassica napus seeds are a source of hirudin which is used as an anti-blood coagulating substance. Flavr savr tomato is a transgenic plant in which the shelf-life of tomato is increased by inhibiting the production of fruit ripening hormone polygalacturonase using the mRNA silencing technique. Somatic hybridization is a cull fusion technique involving the fusion of two complete plant cells carrying desired genes.
